result.execSummary:
The defendant LaPorsha P Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharges to be paid by the end of probation. 
Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription. Maintain absolute sobriety.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapong (Under the Influence of Intoxicant)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LaPorsha P Cooper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant sentenced to serve days 120 DAYS with huber for work in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 9 MONTHS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharges to be paid by the end of probation. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or 
          an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   No firearms; weapons
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed.

Defendant LaPorsha P Cooper in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case 
for the purposes of sentencing.
Concealed carry weapons course comlpetion certificate from GTS Unlimited Firearms Training Academy dated March 29, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant LaPorsha P Cooper in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant LaPorsha P Cooper in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time needed to review offer and reports with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant LaPorsha P Cooper in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant LaPorsha P Cooper in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
